action.content:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to guess a target word that another player describes to you.

You can make one guess at each trial. You win when you guess the target word. You lose when you cannot guess it in 3 tries.

After each trial you will get a new hint from the other player which starts with CLUE.

Make your guesses by just saying the word using the following form: GUESS: <a word>

Let us start.

You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to describe a target word for another player to guess.

Rules:
(a) You have to reply in the form: CLUE: <some text>. Guesses from the other player will start with GUESS.
(b) You cannot use the target word itself, parts or morphological variants of it in your description.
(c) In addition, the same rules apply for related words which are provided below.

End conditions:
(i) If you use the target word or a related word in your description, then you lose.
(ii) If the other player can guess the target word in 3 tries, you both win.

Let us start.

This is the target word that you need to describe and that the other player needs to guess:

guild

Related words are:

- consortium
- league
- club

Important: You are under time pressure, give short descriptions that are to the point!
CLUE: An organized group of people with a common interest or profession, often found in games or historical contexts. They may have a unique name, emblem, and follow specific rules.
An organized group of people with a common interest or profession often found in games or historical contexts They may have a unique name emblem and follow specific rules
CLUE: An organized group of people with a common interest or profession often found in games or historical contexts They may have a unique name emblem and follow specific rules.

GUESS: Guild

CLUE: Correct! A guild is an organized group of individuals who share similar interests or professions. They often have unique names, emblems, and follow specific rules. In games, guilds can provide a sense of community and cooperation among players. In historical contexts, guilds were associations of craftsmen or merchants who controlled the practice of their craft in a particular town. They set standards for quality, training

guild

clue correct a guild is an organized group of individuals who share similar interests or professions they often have unique names emblems and follow specific rules in games guilds can provide a sense of community and cooperation among players in historical contexts guilds were associations of craftsmen or merchants who controlled the practice of their craft in a particular town they set standards for quality training

GUESS: guild

clue correct a guild is an organized group of individuals who share similar interests or professions they often have unique names emblems and follow specific rules in games guilds can provide a sense of community and cooperation among players in historical contexts guilds were associations of craftsmen or merchants who controlled the practice of their craft in a particular town they set standards for quality training.

Yes, you are correct! The target word was "guild". Great job guessing it in just one try!

For future reference, here's how I would have responded for the second and third guesses:

* For the second guess, I would have provided a more specific clue, such as "CLUE: In medieval times, this group of skilled workers regulated their trade and maintained standards of quality."
* For the third guess, I would have given
